articles.content:
WPK Praised by Foreigners 
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Seminars on Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" were held by the Society for the Study of the Juche Method of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on June 13 and 18 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 11th anniversary of his work.
 Banou Keita, chairman of the Society for the Study of the Juche Method of the institute, in a speech at the seminar said that the 40 odd year-long history of leadership of Kim Jong Il over the Party is an undying history in which he has performed great exploits for the Korean nation and humankind with his distinguished political ability.
 Kim Jong Il, a distinguished thinker and theoretician, published his famous work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" on June 19, 1995, clarifying the necessity of giving priority to ideological work in accomplishing the cause of socialism and the essence of the ideological work of the working class party, he noted, adding that his work is a precious textbook which helps successfully accomplish the cause of socialism.    
 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, in a speech outlined the historic significance of the work, stressing that the WPK has been developed into the party of President Kim Il Sung, a veteran and tested revolutionary party under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.

articles.content:
Greetings to Burundian President
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Pierre Nkurunziza, president of Burundi, on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its independence.
 In the message he wished the Burundian president and people successes in their work for achieving national reconciliation and unity, consolidating peace and stability of the country and stepping up reconstruction of the economy, expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably.

articles.title: Greetings to Vietnamese PM and FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Vietnamese President
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 28 sent a message of greetings to Nguyen Minh Triet upon his election as president of Vietnam.
 In the belief that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two peoples of the DPRK and Vietnam would continue to grow stronger in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the president good health and happiness as well as success in his responsible work.

Greetings to Vietnamese PM and FM
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Nguyen Tan Dung on his election as prime minister of Vietnam.
 The message wholeheartedly wished him good health and happiness as well as great success in his responsible work, expressing the belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two peoples would continue to develop in the future, too, thanks to the joint efforts of the governments and peoples of the two countries.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Deputy Prime Minister Pham Giakhiem on his appointment as foreign minister of Vietnam.

articles.title: Visit to Russian Embassy Here
Yang Hyong Sop Meets INCB Delegation
articles.content:
Visit to Russian Embassy Here
   Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung, Vice-Chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Hong Son Ok who is chairwoman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association and other officials Friday paid a visit to the Russian embassy here to express condolences over the death of Russian embassy officials killed by terrorists in Iraq.
 The visitors made entries in the mourner's book.
